articleContent.title: Arpeggio: sus2 in F# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: sus2 in F# (Shape: A)

## Overview
This arpeggio is based on the sus2 chord, consisting of the notes F#-A#-C# in the key of F#. When played as an arpeggio, these notes are sounded individually rather than simultaneously, creating a cascading effect that can add depth and emotion to your playing.

## Notes and Intervals
- F# (Root)
- A# (Major 2nd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The sus2 arpeggio in F# can evoke a dreamy, ethereal quality due to the dissonant major 2nd interval between F# and A#. This arpeggio is often used in genres like ambient music, post-rock, and experimental music to create a sense of openness and intrigue in compositions.

## Songs
1. **"Stargazers" by Oceanize**: This song features the sus2 arpeggio in F# prominently in the opening sequence, creating a mesmerizing atmosphere.
   
2. **"Aurora Borealis" by Celestial Sky**: The sus2 arpeggio in F# is utilized in a hauntingly beautiful melody that captures the essence of the northern lights.

3. **"Ethereal Visions" by Enigma Realm**: In this track, the sus2 arpeggio in F# is layered with atmospheric effects to create a sense of otherworldly tranquility.
